TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: Tuned fishing data for a particular fishing location.

TunableList.name: possible_fish
TunableList.description: If the Sim catches a fish, we'll pick one of these based on their weights. Higher weighted fish have a higher chance of being caught.

TunableTuple.name: luck_option_config
TunableTuple.description: The luck specific data for this option.

Tunable.name: player_perception
Tunable.description: The player's perception of the option, from -100 to 100. For example, if a sim is fishing, pulling up a boot would be seen as -100, while pulling up a treasure chest would be seen as 100.

Tunable.name: show_impacts
Tunable.description: If luck influences the selection process and selects this option, and this bool is True, then we will telegraph that impact to the player. An example of when to turn this off is for 'do nothing' options, where we don't want the game to say 'luck chose something!' but nothing visibly happened for the player.

TunableTuple.name: weight
TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a total multiplier value based on tunable tests.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableList.name: possible_treasures
TunableList.description: If the Sim catches a treasure, we'll pick one of these based on their weights. Higher weighted treasures have a higher chance of being caught.

TunableTuple.name: luck_option_config
TunableTuple.description: The luck specific data for this option.

Tunable.name: player_perception
Tunable.description: The player's perception of the option, from -100 to 100. For example, if a sim is fishing, pulling up a boot would be seen as -100, while pulling up a treasure chest would be seen as 100.

Tunable.name: show_impacts
Tunable.description: If luck influences the selection process and selects this option, and this bool is True, then we will telegraph that impact to the player. An example of when to turn this off is for 'do nothing' options, where we don't want the game to say 'luck chose something!' but nothing visibly happened for the player.

TunableTuple.name: weight
TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a total multiplier value based on tunable tests.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: luck_option_config
TunableTuple.description: The luck specific data for this option.

Tunable.name: player_perception
Tunable.description: The player's perception of the option, from -100 to 100. For example, if a sim is fishing, pulling up a boot would be seen as -100, while pulling up a treasure chest would be seen as 100.

Tunable.name: show_impacts
Tunable.description: If luck influences the selection process and selects this option, and this bool is True, then we will telegraph that impact to the player. An example of when to turn this off is for 'do nothing' options, where we don't want the game to say 'luck chose something!' but nothing visibly happened for the player.

TunableTuple.name: weight
TunableTuple.description: A tunable list of tests and multipliers to apply to the weight used to determine if the Sim will catch a fish instead of treasure or junk. This will be used in conjunction with the Weight Junk and Weight Treasure.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: luck_option_config
TunableTuple.description: The luck specific data for this option.

Tunable.name: player_perception
Tunable.description: The player's perception of the option, from -100 to 100. For example, if a sim is fishing, pulling up a boot would be seen as -100, while pulling up a treasure chest would be seen as 100.

Tunable.name: show_impacts
Tunable.description: If luck influences the selection process and selects this option, and this bool is True, then we will telegraph that impact to the player. An example of when to turn this off is for 'do nothing' options, where we don't want the game to say 'luck chose something!' but nothing visibly happened for the player.

TunableTuple.name: weight
TunableTuple.description: A tunable list of tests and multipliers to apply to the weight used to determine if the Sim will catch junk instead of a fish or treasure. This will be used in conjunction with the Weight Fish and Weight Treasure.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableTuple.description: The luck specific data for this option.

Tunable.name: player_perception
Tunable.description: The player's perception of the option, from -100 to 100. For example, if a sim is fishing, pulling up a boot would be seen as -100, while pulling up a treasure chest would be seen as 100.

Tunable.name: show_impacts
Tunable.description: If luck influences the selection process and selects this option, and this bool is True, then we will telegraph that impact to the player. An example of when to turn this off is for 'do nothing' options, where we don't want the game to say 'luck chose something!' but nothing visibly happened for the player.

TunableTuple.name: weight
TunableTuple.description: A tunable list of tests and multipliers to apply to the weight used to determine if the Sim will catch a treasure instead of fish or junk. This will be used in conjunction with the Weight Fish and Weight Junk.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.
